# SSR Demo

An 'SSR Demo' block to test the ServerSideRender component.

**Contributors:** [ryankienstra](https://profiles.wordpress.org/ryankienstra)
**Requires at least:** 5.0
**Tested up to:** 5.4
**Stable tag:** 0.1.0
**License:** [GPLv3](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html)
**Donate link:** http://jdrf.org/get-involved/ways-to-donate/
**Requires PHP:** 7.1

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/kienstra/ssr-demo.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/kienstra/ssr-demo) [![Built with Grunt](https://gruntjs.com/cdn/builtwith.svg)](http://gruntjs.com)

# Usage

* `composer install && npm install && npm run dev`
* `wp plugin activate ssr-demo`
* Create a new post, and add an 'SSR Demo' block
* Enter a long string in the block, to test whether there's an error:
```

```
* Click outside of the block, so that the `<ServerSideRender>` displays
* Expected: it displays the text entered in the block, without an error, as the `<ServerSideRender>` now uses a `requestBody` prop to make a POST request instead of GET:
![expected-block](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4063887/77261049-45f42380-6c51-11ea-9b41-2be0bfb6ce44.png)
* In the `<InspectorControls>`, un-toggle 'Use requestBody prop':
![untoggle-request-body](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4063887/77261107-b8650380-6c51-11ea-9cbe-664aa8fa2be8.png)
* Click outside of the block again, to render the `<ServerSideRender>`
* Expected: it now displays an error, as the text was too long, and it's now sent in a GET request:
![error-ssr-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4063887/77261155-0c6fe800-6c52-11ea-9a47-0a789aa46075.png)
